pr_title: KOGITO-1661 : BPMN Examples have 'null' in process type property

timeline.bodyText: @inodeman  so the fix is just about initializing the processType with the default public value, right? Sounds ok for me, but could then we also remove the field PROCESS_TYPE_EDEFAULT, is being used somewhere else?
timeline.author: romartin

replies.bodyText: It is used on another places, shouldn't be the PROCESS_TYPE_EDEFAULT set to ProcessType.PUBLIC?
replies.author: tomasdavidorg

replies.bodyText: Hi @romartin @tomasdavidorg I tried setting the default to public, but the side effect is that if a process is set to public, then it is not saved. Then to make it work I have to change several files. Let me know
replies.author: inodeman

replies.bodyText: @inodeman TBH I think it results confusing having the PROCESS_TYPE_EDEFAULT field, but not using it for the initialization of processType, although is actually working this way. Ping me and we can do a quick look at this together, np! 👍
replies.author: romartin

timeline.message: KOGITO-1661 : BPMN Examples have 'null' in process type property
